pull.title: ci: Install missing lint packages
pull.body: The cirrus container is vanilla ubuntu, so we need to install the needed packages

issue.title: ci: Move linter task to cirrus
issue.body: Solves #20467: Move linter to Cirrus-CI as Travis-CI.org is shutting down

events.body:
Concept ACK fa631218084f27df3ff379dceb3dcd3ecaf3d4cc

Sorry, but I don't see any reason in the recent [push](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/compare/fa1333058ebfd5a5323bfcad61b754f6b319d35b..fa631218084f27df3ff379dceb3dcd3ecaf3d4cc).

Also I'd suggest to separate `COMMIT_RANGE` related changes into their own commit, or--better--into a separated PR.

> Sorry, but I don't see any reason in the recent push.

curl is used by the linters

> > Sorry, but I don't see any reason in the recent push.
> 
> curl is used by the linters

`curl` is already in `apt install -y clang-format-9 python3-pip curl git` :)

And `wget` is not used by the linters:
```
$ git grep -e 'wget' test/lint/ | wc -l
0
```

issue.title: ci, doc: Travis CI features and mentions cleanup
issue.body:
As Travis CI is no longer used, this PR:
- drops `travis_fold` feature
- drops mentions of Travis CI in docs

issue.title: ci: Fix COMMIT_RANGE variable value for PRs
issue.body:
This PR:
- is a #20658 and #20682  followup 
- set the `COMMIT_RANGE` variable correctly for PRs
- cleans up Travis-specific code
- prints COMMIT_RANGE value to the log for convenience as it was in Travis CI

events.body:
> > Also I'd suggest to separate COMMIT_RANGE related changes into their own commit, or--better--into a separated PR.
> 
> Dropped here

Mind looking into #20697 ?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -70,16 +70,8 @@ task:
     memory: 1G
   # For faster CI feedback, immediately schedule the linters
   << : *CREDITS_TEMPLATE
-  setup_script:
-    - set -o errexit; source ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh
-  before_install_script:
-    - set -o errexit; source ./ci/test/03_before_install.sh
-  install_script:
-    - set -o errexit; source ./ci/lint/04_install.sh
-  before_script:
-    - set -o errexit; source ./ci/lint/05_before_script.sh
   lint_script:
-    - set -o errexit; source ./ci/lint/06_script.sh
+    - ./ci/lint_run_all.sh
comments.body:
I understand that it follows the way how we use the `./ci/test_run_all.sh` script, but it seems more readable and maintainable to do not introduce a second-level script:
```
  lint_script: |
    set -o errexit
    source ./ci/test/00_setup_env.sh
    source ./ci/test/03_before_install.sh
    source ./ci/lint/04_install.sh
    source ./ci/lint/05_before_script.sh
    source ./ci/lint/06_script.sh
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -6,7 +6,7 @@
 
 export LC_ALL=C
 
-${CI_RETRY_EXE} apt update && apt install -y clang-format-9 python3-pip curl git
+${CI_RETRY_EXE} apt update && apt install -y clang-format-9 python3-pip curl git gawk jq curl wget
comments.body:
```suggestion
${CI_RETRY_EXE} apt-get update
${CI_RETRY_EXE} apt-get install -y clang-format-9 python3-pip curl git gawk jq
```

comments.body: The script makes it also easier to run locally with just one command
